oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Captopril Provides Sustained Hemodynamic Benefits in Dogs with Experimentally Induced Mitral Regurgitation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blackford, L. A.
Golden, A. L.
Bright, J. M.
Bright, R. M.
Gompf, R. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mitral regurgitation
congestive heart failure
captopril
hemodynamic effect
graduate research
dogs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mitral regurgitation (MR) often leads to congestive heart failure which is aggravated by compensatory responses mediated by the sympathetic nervous system and the renin-angiotensin- aldosterone system. These mechanisms contribute to increased total peripheral resistance (TPR) and retention of sodium and water. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the immediate and long-term hemodynamic effects of captopril, an angiotension converting enzyme inhibitor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 124
